name: Coleslaw With Creamy Chili Vinaigrette
description: A simple and refreshing coleslaw that balances the sweet, floral heat of Fresno chili in a tangy and creamy vinaigrette.
recipeIngredient: 1 Fresno chili pepper (20g), stemmed and seeded
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more for seasoning
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more for seasoning
10 ounces (280g) shredded green or Savoy cabbage

recipeInstructions.text: For the Chili Vinaigrette: Add all ingredients except cream to the jar of a blender and blend on high until smooth, scraping down sides of blender jar as needed with a flexible spatula. Turn the blender on low speed and slowly add cream to emulsify. Season vinaigrette to taste with salt and pepper.

For the Slaw: Combine cabbages and carrots in a large bowl. Pour chili vinaigrette over cabbage mixture and toss to coat. Let slaw sit for at least 10 to 15 minutes before serving. (I tend to like my slaw a little more wilted, so I let it sit for 30 minutes.) Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt if desired. Cover slaw and refrigerate until ready to serve.
